New Records: Pathum Nissanka moved past a thousand ODI runs this year - the second to do so after India's Shubman Gill.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 146 balls remaining)
Lahiru Kumara is player of the match for his 3 for 35
Liam Livingstone was out leg before for 0
Adil Rashid was run out for 0
Pre-Game Insights: England head coach Matthew Mott was equally disappointed: "We came here full of hope to turn things around and we're well off the mark. It's going to be a real test of character to go through the next week and see what we can salvage."
Post-Match Reflections: It's the fifth time Sri Lanka have beaten England in World Cups, and all the more damning for Jos Buttler's side is they have succumbed to a third heavy loss.
This one registers as the shortest match of the tournament (59 overs).
Miscellaneous Highlights: England were dismissed with 100 balls to spare
Sri Lanka have been as good as England have been abject - highlighted by the fact this is the lowest ODI total at the Chinnaswamy stadium.
Others: Angelo Mathews returned to the team after a long break and took 1 wicket for 0 runs in 1 over.
David Willey was not best pleased with being left out of the central contract for next year.
